newsitem.title: USA: CellularVision offers new Internet access.
newsitem.headline: CellularVision offers new Internet access.

text.p: CellularVision USA said Monday it started offering its high-speed wireless Internet-access product in the New York City area.

CellularVision Digital Network, or CVDN 500, uses wireless Local Multipoint Distribution Service (LMDS) technology, which allows users to bypass telephone lines to access the Internet at 500 kbps, or about four times the speed of an ISDN line and about 20 times the speed of a typical consumer's 28.8 kbps modem, the company said.

For businesses, CVDN 500 is available for a one-time installation fee of $229 and a monthly access fee of $79.95. The price for residential users is $49.95 per month and a one-time installation fee of $199.
CellularVision of New York, a unit of CellularVision USA, has started marketing CVDN 500 in Manhattan and Brooklyn, where the company offers a 49-channel subscription television service.
CellularVision said it is the exclusive government-licensed LMDS provider in the United States.
